raw_text:
Based on the paper content, I'll extract the structured information following the required format:

```json
{
  "paper_metadata": {
    "title": "The Development Approach to Refugee Assistance: Evidence from a New Settlement in Kenya",
    "matches_expected_title": "YES"
  },
  "program_information": {
    "program_name": "Kalobeyei Settlement Development Program",
    "country": "Kenya",
    "region": "North-West Kenya",
    "target_population": "Refugees"
  },
  "intervention_components": {
    "component_a_cash_support": {
      "component_a_present": true,
      "cash_support_type": "mobile money transfers (Bamba Chakula)",
      "cash_amount": "KES1400 (~US$14) per person per month",
      "cash_frequency": "monthly",
      "is_loan_or_credit": "NO",
      "cash_evidence_citation": "in-kind food rations had been almost entirely replaced by a system of mobile-money transfers called Bamba Chakula | refugees living in Kalobeyei can choose to buy the food they prefer using Bamba Chakula"
    },
    "component_b_assets": {
      "component_b_present": false,
      "assets_provided": [],
      "direct_provision": "NO",
      "assets_evidence_citation": null
    }
  },
  "study_characteristics": {
    "outcomes_measured": [
      "food security",
      "dietary diversity",
      "calorie intake",
      "assets",
      "employment",
      "well-being",
      "independence from aid",
      "agriculture participation"
    ],
    "outcomes_evidence_citation": "The results of this regression discontinuity analysis indicate that refugees who arrived shortly after the cutoff date do better in terms of dietary diversity, calorie intake, and food security than those arriving just before. By contrast, we find no effect on assets and on non-food spending.",
    "study_design": "Regression Discontinuity Design",
    "design_evidence_citation": "We use a regression discontinuity design to assess the short-run effect of the development approach promoted in Kalobeyei",
    "is_review_or_policy_analysis": false,
    "publication_year": null,
    "study_conducted_year": "2017",
    "sample_size": null,
    "completed": true
  },
  "bonus_information": {
    "has_qualitative_components": false,
    "qualitative_methods": [],
    "qualitative_evidence_citation": null,
    "has_cost_data": true,
    "cost_mentions": "Cost comparison between cash and in-kind transfers",
    "cost_evidence_citation": "In 2017, WFP Kenya estimated that the total cost of delivering US$1 to beneficiaries was US$1.18 for Bamba Chakula transfers compared to US$1.94 for in-kind food transfers"
  },
  "evidence_citations": {
    "program_name_citation": "In May 2016, a third refugee hosting site, the Kalobeyei settlement, was opened in Kenya, just 3.5 kilometers away from the old Kakuma camp",
    "country_citation": "In May 2016, a third refugee hosting site, the Kalobeyei settlement, was opened in Kenya",
    "target_population_citation": "This analysis draws on data from a representative household survey of refugees who were living in Kakuma camp and Kalobeyei settlement in September and October 2017"
  }
}
```
